title: Asahi's Big Computer Problem
summary: Asahi, a big beer company in Japan, had a computer attack in September. Hackers broke into their computers and might have taken information from over 1.5 million customers. This includes names, addresses, and phone numbers. The attack made it hard for Asahi to work, so employees had to use pen and paper. Asahi is telling people who might be affected and is working to fix the problem. They said no credit card information was stolen. The company is focusing on this instead of sharing their money results right now.

background_read: Cyber-attacks are when hackers try to steal or damage computer data. Companies like Asahi store customer information to help with service. Ransomware is a common attack where hackers demand money to unlock files. It's important for companies to protect data to keep people safe.
